channel.title: The Bootstrap on Amit Rajan
channel.description: Recent content in The Bootstrap on Amit Rajan

item.title: ISLR Chapter 5: Resampling Methods (Part 2: The Bootstrap)
item.description: 5.2 The Bootstrap Bootstrap can be used to to quantify the uncertainty associated with a given statistical model. For example, bootstrap can be used to estimate standard errors (which measures the uncertainty) of the coefficients from a linear regression fit. Bootstrap can be applied to a wide range of statistical learning methods. The method of bootstrap is explained below via an example: Suppose we wish to invest money in two financial assests which yield returns of $X$ and $Y$.
